alert.note: Alert for St Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 19 at 5:01PM AST until September 20 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive runoff and the potential for additional rainfall. * WHERE...Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The potential for showers and thunderstorms continues with additional rainfall totals between 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts expected, particularly across portions of southern Puerto Rico tonight into Tuesday. Soils are extremely saturated and rivers are running well above normal levels. Therefore the risk for flash flooding as well as mudslides and rockfalls continues. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
